intro: Canthium bogosense, commonly known as the bog canthium, is a flowering plant native to moist, acidic environments such as bogs and wetlands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature, aiding in its dispersal. Canthium bogosense plays a role in maintaining the ecological balance of wetland habitats by providing food and shelter for various insect and bird species.
